meanings.definition: The act or process of making something less dense or more spread out.
meanings.sent1: The rarefaction of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent2: The rarefaction of the dough made it easier to shape into bread.
meanings.sent3: The rarefaction of the crowd at the concert made finding a seat a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The rarefaction of the forest canopy created a magical pattern of light and shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The rarefaction of the fog revealed the distant mountains in all their glory.

meanings.definition: A decrease in the density of a substance or medium.
meanings.sent1: The rarefaction of the air in the balloon caused it to slowly deflate.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed a rarefaction in the water levels of the lake during the dry season.
meanings.sent3: The rarefaction of the ice cream in the cone made it melt faster on the hot day.
meanings.sent4: The rarefaction of the traffic on the highway allowed for a smooth drive home.
meanings.sent5: The rarefaction of the stars in the sky made each one shine brighter.

meanings.definition: The state of being less dense or more spread out.
meanings.sent1: The rarefaction of the fog created a dreamy atmosphere in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: The rarefaction of the paint on the canvas gave the artwork a delicate appearance.
meanings.sent3: The rarefaction of the books on the shelf made it look tidier and more organized.
meanings.sent4: The rarefaction of the leaves on the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The rarefaction of the sand on the beach revealed hidden seashells beneath.
